content:
• Friday, March 16, 2012
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) +1.8% AH after shareholder G Asset Management offers to buy 51% of...

    Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) +1.8% AH after shareholder G Asset Management offers to buy 51% of the company's college bookstore business for $460M. The business, which B&N bought for $596M in 2009, is a cash cow, but its sales fell 3% Y/Y in the January quarter, as online competition begins to have an impact.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • PACD

    Pacific Drilling (NYSE:PACD) +4.4% AH after announcing it has exercised an option to "construct...

    Pacific Drilling (NYSE:PACD) +4.4% AH after announcing it has exercised an option to "construct its seventh ultra-deepwater drillship with Samsung Heavy Industries." The ship is expected to cost roughly $600M, and be delivered in May 2014. Pacific will pay for the ship using a combination of debt and cash flows from operations.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM
  • DNKN

    Dunkin' Brands (NASDAQ:DNKN) -1.4% AH after disclosing insiders - primarily P-E firms Bain...

    Dunkin' Brands (NASDAQ:DNKN) -1.4% AH after disclosing insiders - primarily P-E firms Bain Capital, Carlyle, and Thomas H. Lee - will be selling 22M shares (18% of all outstanding shares) through a secondary offering that will occur in Q2. Following the sale, Bain, Carlyle, and Thomas H. Lee will each own a 12.5% stake in Dunkin, down from a current 18.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • UNH

    UnitedHealth (NYSE:UNH) +2.2% AH after Bloomberg reports the company has received a $20.5B...

    UnitedHealth (NYSE:UNH) +2.2% AH after Bloomberg reports the company has received a $20.5B healthcare services contract from the Pentagon.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • OVTI

    Chipworks provides confirmation OmniVision (OVTI +2.1%) image sensors are used for both the new...

    Chipworks provides confirmation OmniVision (OVTI +2.1%) image sensors are used for both the new iPad's front and rear cameras - shares had already risen on expectations this would be the case. The 5MP OV5650 sensor, already used in the iPhone 4, powers the rear camera, while the 0.3MP OV297AA sensor, found in the iPod Nano and iPad 2, powers the front camera.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • DPZ

    Domino's Pizza (NYSE:DPZ) +2.6% after completing its recapitalization and declaring a $3/share...

    Domino's Pizza (NYSE:DPZ) +2.6% after completing its recapitalization and declaring a $3/share special dividend. "Paying less in interest, along with the stability of a fixed interest rate over the next seven years, and the flexibility of an available revolver, gives us the ability to invest in the business and reward shareholders,"Â CEO Patrick Doyle says. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • KOS

    Kosmos Energy (KOS +6.1%) shares surge after announcing it encountered "substantial" light oil...

    Kosmos Energy (KOS +6.1%) shares surge after announcing it encountered "substantial" light oil in multiple good quality reservoirs at the Enyenra-4A well offshore Ghana. The oil and gas E&P company has gained attention as the discoverer of Ghana's massive offshore Jubilee field.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • OII

    Oceaneering International (OII +3.1%) is raised to Accumulate from Hold at Tudor Pickering,...

    Oceaneering International (OII +3.1%) is raised to Accumulate from Hold at Tudor Pickering, which praises the company's Q4 results and notes its leverage to the deepwater market and strong balance sheet. The firm says OII shares should continue to outperform due to deepwater dayrate improvement and additional newbuild floater announcements.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • SHPG

    Shire (SHPGY +1.8%) trades higer after JP Morgan upped the shares to Overweight on valuation...

    Shire (SHPGY +1.8%) trades higer after JP Morgan upped the shares to Overweight on valuation earlier today, citing potential upside from Vyvanse.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • RIG

    Transocean (RIG +4.8%) shares surge as the offshore driller said it reached a deal to get...

    Transocean (RIG +4.8%) shares surge as the offshore driller said it reached a deal to get $650K/day for one of its rigs, "the highest dayrate we have seen in the current upcycle," Susquehanna says. The amount is "particularly encouraging," the firm adds, as the Deepwater Expedition had its prior contract cancelled in January due to non-performance. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • ADTN

    ThinkEquity cuts its rating for Adtran (ADTN -5%) to Hold from Buy and lowers its price target...

    ThinkEquity cuts its rating for Adtran (ADTN -5%) to Hold from Buy and lowers its price target to $35 from $40 a day after ADTN warned that it expects March earnings and sales to come in well below previous expectations. "While the direction of the miss was not a surprise to us, the magnitude surprised us," the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • AXAS

    Abraxas Petroleum (AXAS -10.2%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at SunTrust Robinson Humphrey,...

    Abraxas Petroleum (AXAS -10.2%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at SunTrust Robinson Humphrey, which notes production delays and reduced natural gas production that led to Q4 results missing guidance as well as financing concerns for the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • BTU

    Coal stocks (KOL +1.4%) trade higher, helped in part by excitement stirred up by chatter tipping...

    Coal stocks (KOL +1.4%) trade higher, helped in part by excitement stirred up by chatter tipping off that Warren Buffett is kicking the tires of several names in the sector. Leading the charge: BTU +5.5%, PCX +10.1%, ANR +6.3%, JRCC +4.1%, WLT +2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 3 Comments
  • PRMW

    Primo Water (PRMW -20.2%) craters after reporting a disappointing Q4 and guidance late...

    Primo Water (PRMW -20.2%) craters after reporting a disappointing Q4 and guidance late yesterday. Janney Capital cuts the shares to Neutral on the back of the weak results.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • BB

    Possibly contributing to Research In Motion's (RIMM +5.4%) rally (previously) is a rumor Samsung...

    Possibly contributing to Research In Motion's (RIMM +5.4%) rally (previously) is a rumor Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) will make a minority investment in the struggling smartphone maker. BGC's Collin Gillis notes Samsung is nervous over Google's acquisition of Motorola Mobility. However, RIM/Samsung rumors are nothing new (I, II), and Samsung is already supporting 3 smartphone platforms.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • SNV

    Synovus (SNV -3.3%) dips after Credit Suisse cut the shares to Neutral on valuation, noting the...

    Synovus (SNV -3.3%) dips after Credit Suisse cut the shares to Neutral on valuation, noting the private market value of the company is $2.00 - $2.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • CHMT

    Chemtura (CHMT +5.3%) shares surge after Oppenheimer upgrades its rating on the maker of...

    Chemtura (CHMT +5.3%) shares surge after Oppenheimer upgrades its rating on the maker of additives for plastics to Outperform, "as its long restructuring post-bankruptcy takes hold, Q4's margin expansion looks to have legs, and the rebound in electronics flame retardants, its most profitable segment, is faster than expected."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • PBI

    Mail and document-services company Pitney Bowes (PBI -2.6%) slips after Moody's put the...

    Mail and document-services company Pitney Bowes (PBI -2.6%) slips after Moody's put the company's investment-grade ratings on review for a possible downgrade because of the continuing deterioration of its operating results.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • FUELQ

    Shares of SMF Energy (NASDAQ:FUEL) pop a circuit breaker after falling 47.4%. The carnage comes...

    Shares of SMF Energy (NASDAQ:FUEL) pop a circuit breaker after falling 47.4%. The carnage comes about as the firm slashes its estimates on revenue and earnings for the current reporting period and suspends its dividend.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • WRK

    Rock-Tenn (RKT -4.1%) issues downside Q2 guidance, seeing Q2 EPS of $0.85-$0.90 vs. $1.16...

    Rock-Tenn (RKT -4.1%) issues downside Q2 guidance, seeing Q2 EPS of $0.85-$0.90 vs. $1.16 consensus, as the packaging and paper company is hurt by maintenance downtime and lower selling prices for export containerboard. RKT expects "significant earnings improvement" from Q4 onward when it completes major projects at the Hodge and Hopewell mills.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Another nugget from Sears Holdings' (SHLD) 10-K filing: The company's pension plan returned a...

    Another nugget from Sears Holdings' (SHLD) 10-K filing: The company's pension plan returned a paltry 1% in 2011, which led to a massive underfunding based on the assumption it would return 7.5%. According to estimates from Paulo Santos, this puts cash needs at a "whopping" $1.05B and $1.43B over the next 3 years. But somewhat typical with Sears, the worse the news seemingly sounds - the higher shares go. SHLD +1.3% for the day, +166% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 3 Comments
  • PRTS

    U.S. Auto Parts (PRTS -1.6%) trades lower after Barrington downgraded the shares to Market...

    U.S. Auto Parts (PRTS -1.6%) trades lower after Barrington downgraded the shares to Market Perform on the back of the company's recent weak Q4 results and ongoing price competition.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • KITD

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD +4.1%) recoups some of yesterday's post-earnings losses, the result of...

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD +4.1%) recoups some of yesterday's post-earnings losses, the result of weak guidance and a delayed 10-K filing, after Canaccord and ThinkEquity come to its defense. Canaccord declares the video management software developer to be well-positioned to benefit from global online video growth, and sees healthy results as a near-term catalyst for shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • DOLE

    Dole Food (DOLE +12.1%) is one of the day's top gainers after the company swung to a Q4 profit,...

    Dole Food (DOLE +12.1%) is one of the day's top gainers after the company swung to a Q4 profit, helped by cost cuts to protect margins in the face of volatile demand for bananas, its top-selling item. However, Deutsche Bank cut its price target on the stock to $11 from $12 saying the North American banana market remains "challenging."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • UAA

    Under Armour (UA -1.8%), which has soared in 2012, sells off after D.A. Davidson starts coverage...

    Under Armour (UA -1.8%), which has soared in 2012, sells off after D.A. Davidson starts coverage with a Neutral, arguing the high-end sports apparel brand's growth prospects are reflected in its lofty valuation, and that "near-term headwinds" exist. The firm is also starting coverage on rival Nike (NKE +0.5%) with a Buy, on a belief its track record and growth potential justify a premium valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • FRO

    Shipping and tanker stocks run red hot off with Frontline (FRO +19.7%) leading the pack. Traders...

    Shipping and tanker stocks run red hot off with Frontline (FRO +19.7%) leading the pack. Traders attribute the strong move to a momentum swing after the Baltic Dry Index finally pulled out of its death spiral earlier this year. Gainers: OSG +8.3%, SFL +5.7%, DRYS +5.9%, PRGN +4.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • AMRN

    Shares of Amarin (AMRN +12.2%) soar after the USPTO updates its transaction history for one of...

    Shares of Amarin (AMRN +12.2%) soar after the USPTO updates its transaction history for one of the company's patents to read in a more positive light. At least part of the rise in Amarin's share price can also be attributed to ongoing M&A chatter kicked off earlier this week.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • CTCM

    CTC Media (CTCM -1.4%) slides after Deutsche cut the shares to Hold on valuation, citing limited...

    CTC Media (CTCM -1.4%) slides after Deutsche cut the shares to Hold on valuation, citing limited upside potential in light of recent gains since January.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • DEER

    Deer Consumer Products (OTC:DEER -3.3%) says its filing of its 2011 annual report will be...

    Deer Consumer Products (OTC:DEER -3.3%) says its filing of its 2011 annual report will be delayed, citing additional time needed to assess the effectiveness of its disclosure controls and internal controls over financial reporting. The Chinese kitchen appliance producer has been wrestling with negative accusations from online bloggers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • BB

    It looks like no news is good news for Research In Motion (RIMM +5.2%). Shares are jumping after...

    It looks like no news is good news for Research In Motion (RIMM +5.2%). Shares are jumping after RIM announced it would release its FQ4 report on March 29 ... and didn't provide a warning to go with its statement, after having repeatedly done so with similar announcements in the past. Many on the Street expected a warning to arrive.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 4 Comments
  • EL

    Caris takes its rating on Estee Lauder (EL -1.8%) down to Above Average from Buy on a valuation...

    Caris takes its rating on Estee Lauder (EL -1.8%) down to Above Average from Buy on a valuation call after the cosmetics company etched out an all-time high of $63.91 yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • BWLD

    Shares of Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD -2.5%) get tripped up by a downgrade by Wedbush to Neutral...

    Shares of Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD -2.5%) get tripped up by a downgrade by Wedbush to Neutral from Outperform after analysts identify margin risk for the company. Taking a pulse on the Street shows that BWLD is still on the books with 8 Buy or Overweight ratings, 9 Holds, and one lonely Sell.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM | 1 Comment
  • GTY

    Investors aren't taking kindly to news that Getty Realty (NYSE:GTY) plans to defer its next...

    Investors aren't taking kindly to news that Getty Realty (NYSE:GTY) plans to defer its next dividend payment after fretting over its cash flow situation. Shares are down 10.8% on heavy volume after the firm also reported Q4 earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • VTG

    Shares of Vantage Drilling (NYSEMKT:VTG) ride an upgrade from Dahlman Rose 10.7% higher....

    Shares of Vantage Drilling (NYSEMKT:VTG) ride an upgrade from Dahlman Rose 10.7% higher. Analysts raise up their rating on the offshore driller to Buy from Hold after deciding that the company is likely to finance two of its drillships without taking on additional equity.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • NOV

    National Oilwell Varco (NOV +2.6%) shares enjoy a boost after Jim Cramer says the company...

    National Oilwell Varco (NOV +2.6%) shares enjoy a boost after Jim Cramer says the company dominates oil rig technology as much as Apple does in consumer electronics and media. NOV trades for 12x earnings estimates and just 1x its growth rate, and Cramer says those metrics indicate the stock should be trading ~60% higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM | 5 Comments
  • ACHV

    OncoGenex Pharmaceuticals (OGXI -18.9%) dives after stating the share offering announced...

    OncoGenex Pharmaceuticals (OGXI -18.9%) dives after stating the share offering announced yesterday will involve selling 4.165M shares at a price of just $12. Even after today's crash, OncoGenex shares are changing hands at $14.47.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • CRZO

    Atlas Resource Partners (ARP +15.2%) says it will purchase Barnett Shale properties from Carrizo...

    Atlas Resource Partners (ARP +15.2%) says it will purchase Barnett Shale properties from Carrizo Oil &Â Gas (CRZO +2.3%) for ~$190M in cash. ARP also raises its distribution forecast for H2 2012 to $0.85-$0.90 per limited partner unit, up from its previous outlook of $0.80.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • NXTM

    Leerink calls out NxStage Medical (NXTM +1.6%) for a quick gain today after the Medicare Payment...

    Leerink calls out NxStage Medical (NXTM +1.6%) for a quick gain today after the Medicare Payment Advisory Committee released a report last night that included a positive spin on home hemodialysis reimbursement - viewed as positive for the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • EXM

    Excel Maritime Carriers (NYSE:EXM): Q4 EPS of -$0.24 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $81.9M (-23.5%...

    Excel Maritime Carriers (NYSE:EXM): Q4 EPS of -$0.24 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $81.9M (-23.5% Y/Y) beats by $8M. Shares +4.6%. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM
  • SINA

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) -3.3% after Reuters reports of widespread frustration with new regulations...

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) -3.3% after Reuters reports of widespread frustration with new regulations requiring Weibo users to register their real names. It's added only 19M users out of Weibo's base of 300M have registered (far less than Sina predicted would do so by now), and in spite of the government's threats, many are determined not to. Sina has rallied in recent weeks on hopes the new regulations would do limited damage.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • S

    Shares of Clearwire (CLWR) post a 3.6% gain premarket after Sprint decides that it will...

    Shares of Clearwire (CLWR) post a 3.6% gain premarket after Sprint decides that it will terminate its spectrum hosting agreement with LightSquared due to unresolved interference issues.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • OXSQ

    Shares of Technology Investment Capital (TICC) shed 5.1% in premarket trading after the...

    Shares of Technology Investment Capital (TICC) shed 5.1% in premarket trading after the specialty finance firm announces a public offering of 4.25M shares of its common stock at a discounted price of $9.96 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • STLD

    Steel Dynamics (NASDAQ:STLD) -1.5% premarket after offering lower Q1 guidance, seeing EPS of...

    Steel Dynamics (NASDAQ:STLD) -1.5% premarket after offering lower Q1 guidance, seeing EPS of $0.15-$0.20 vs $0.36 consensus. Improvements in steel and metals recycling operations are expected to be tempered by "unexpected margin compression that began to occur mid-quarter."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM
  • RIG

    Global Hunter upgrades Transocean (NYSE:RIG) to a Buy rating from Neutral after analysts meet...

    Global Hunter upgrades Transocean (NYSE:RIG) to a Buy rating from Neutral after analysts meet with project managers to take a pulse on the status of the firm's operations. "While there are still many rigs left to be cycled through the yard, we feel that incrementally the business will perform up to its previous standards set." Shares +3.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM
  • CYTX

    Cytori Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CYTX) +9.5% premarket after announcing it received 510(k) clearance...

    Cytori Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CYTX) +9.5% premarket after announcing it received 510(k) clearance from the FDA for its Puregraft 850 System for body contouring using a patient's own fat.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM
  • ARIA

    A FDA panel questions the risks and side effects of a drug developed by Ariad Pharmaceuticals...

    A FDA panel questions the risks and side effects of a drug developed by Ariad Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARIA) and Merck (NYSE:MRK) to treat sarcoma. Shares of ARIA -1.9% premarket, MRK inactive.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • NTR

    BMO makes the call that it believes potash activity in the U.S. has picked up over the last few...

    BMO makes the call that it believes potash activity in the U.S. has picked up over the last few weeks and forecasts a solid spring season. Premarket: Potash (POT) +1.5%, Mosaic (NYSE:MOS) +1.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • PWRD

    Morgan Stanley calls for a further breakout in Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD), as it opens a 60-day...

    Morgan Stanley calls for a further breakout in Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD), as it opens a 60-day Research Tactical Idea on the stock. Analysts say a combination of the company's generous dividend policy, strong cash position, and low valuation feed right into their thesis. Shares +26.4% after reporting Q4 earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM
  • MTEM

    Threshold Pharmaceuticals (THLD) receives orphan drug designation in the EU for its TH-302...

    Threshold Pharmaceuticals (THLD) receives orphan drug designation in the EU for its TH-302 treatment for soft tissue sarcoma after early studies showed positive results with patients. The company is currently in critical phase 3 testing on the drug. Shares +4.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 AM

  • EU shares open moderately higher following firm U.S. jobs and manufacturing data yesterday,...

    EU shares open moderately higher following firm U.S. jobs and manufacturing data yesterday, although options expirations could keep markets on edge. Euro STOXX 50 +0.1% to 2598,80, its strongest since August, London +0.1%, Paris +0.1%, Frankfurt +0.15%, Madrid +0.2%, Milan +0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 AM
  • UPS

    UPS (NYSE:UPS) reiterates its plan to make an offer for TNT Express and intends to file for the...

    UPS (NYSE:UPS) reiterates its plan to make an offer for TNT Express and intends to file for the approval of its bid documents to Dutch market regulator AFM by May 11. Despite TNT rebuffing UPS's €4.9B ($6.4B) offer, the firms remain in talks, although the latter is not expected to raise its bid due to TNT's poor results and the lack of a rival suitor. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 AM

  • Asian shares are mixed as many traders see out the week on the sidelines. Japan +0.1%, Hong Kong...

    Asian shares are mixed as many traders see out the week on the sidelines. Japan +0.1%, Hong Kong -0.1%, China +1.3%, India +0.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 AM
